page.title: 01A Slice of mid-Norfolk
page.content: {The area is mainly covered by arable {farmland but contains the villages of {Salhouse,Little Plumstead and {Rackheath.It is crossed by three of {the roads which radiate from Norwich, {the county town of Norfolk.To the {north and east are the Norfolk Broads, {a popular holiday area.Although there {is employment in traditional local {industries,farming and a new {industrial estate at Rackheath,many of {the people who live in the villages {commute to and from Norwich to work. {The villages contain a mixture of {housing from ancient thatched cottages {to modern housing estates.Public {transport,both by road and rail is {very limited and, as in many other {parts of Norfolk, the car is a {necessity rather than a luxury. }
